New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history with two outs in the 10th inning
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning
Giancarlo Stanton launched a two-run homer for New York
Freddie Freeman ran out to give high-fives to his teammates, feeling good after the home run
Pre-Game Insights: The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts marveled at the greatest baseball moment he's ever witnessed
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the 12th time the Yankees and Dodgers are meeting in the World Series
The first Series with a pair of 50-home run hitters in Judge (58) and Ohtani (54)
Fernando Valenzuela, the 1981 NL Cy Young Award winner and Rookie of the Year, was honored with a moment of silence before the game
